column4: Can someone please tell me what the default run level on a gutsy desktop is ?
2-5 is same so 2
you can play with /etc/network/interfaces file

after having trouble with my wireless card to initialize after reboot, someone suggested to compile the RT61 driver specifically.... the readme says "choose ra0 for first RT61 WLAN card" to load at bootup but I have no idea where to set that, so I would like to undo if possible
my wirless card does not even appear in network manager now, but lspci show it
wireless drivers are normally found in /lib/firmware/`uname -r`
I can see a couple of related bin files there, what next ?
e.g. rt2561.bin and rt2561s.bin Do I delete these ?
did the README file instruct you to put it on that dir or its subdirs? or symlinks if not put there permanently?
I'll pastebin the readme if that is ok ?
i dont want to really read the full text, what does it basically say?
or they may have put the modules in  /lib/modules/`uname -r`/ubuntu/wireless
it asked me to make all, install, and cp .bin files to /etc/Wireless/RT61STA/ which I had to mkdir. It does not mention /lib/firmware but the make/install may have done something
at the risk of wasting your time, the readme is here: http://pastebin.ubuntu.com/3337/
possibly, look in those two dirs i mentioned and see if the date matches the time you installed or at least gives you an idea that the drivers are in those directories
I found a lib/modules/2.6.22-14-generic/extra.rt61.ko but hard for me to tell where else. A few files ahve been touched in there e.g. many modules.*
what about at  /lib/firmware/`uname -r` ?
what does the `uname -r`mean. sorry to be a newbie
but no files in /lib/firmware/2.6.22-14-generic/ changed or added
man uname
thank you I assumed something like that, ta
btw, something seems to have taken with the compile/make/install as my restricted drivers manager lists it
its getting late for me..sorry..am off now..
thanks for trying
